meanings.definition: An object that one cannot or does not wish to give a specific name to.
meanings.sent1: I found some mysterious thingies in the attic.
meanings.sent2: She collects all sorts of thingies from her travels.
meanings.sent3: The thingies in the box seemed to have a secret life of their own.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a jumble of thingies, each one representing a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The thingies on the shelf whispered stories of the past.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic used tiny thingies to fix the watch.
meanings.sent2: She always carries around a bag full of useful thingies.
meanings.sent3: The thingies in his pocket jingled as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with colorful thingies that sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The little thingies on the table caught her eye with their intricate designs.

meanings.sent1: He asked her to grab a few thingies from the store.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a pinch of various thingies.
meanings.sent3: The box was full of random thingies that made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were filled with strange thingies floating in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling all sorts of thingies.
